comment: It has that great bready nose that I love from complex ryes, but it's surprisingly "thin" on first sip. That's not to say it not enjoyable by any means, but the higher-aged Willetts are more what I'm looking for. Without taking price into consideration, this is a great rye.
Had this one at Paper Planes in San Jose. So good I ordered another glass.
Best rye I've prolly ever had
Yum! Tons of flavor. A lot of which I still can't describe. Loved it! Tasted at distiller headquarters.
Amazing, complex flavor without an overwhelming bite.  Very strong lingering spice that's just the right amount.
Wow. I mean, WOW. Easily my favorite rye of all time. Smooth, subtle and I'm in love! $116/bottle? Dammit!
Unfortunately didn't love it. Great spicy nose but all I tasted was pepper without balance or anything else to round it out.

Nose: spicy, apple pie, vanilla.  
Palate: somewhat full body, spicy, vanilla, but finish is tannic.  Not terribly balanced on the flavors.  After being in a glencairn for awhile the finish mellows to almost nothing.    
Overall- it is not a bad rye, I like the age, nose and initial mouthfeel.  It is not one of my favorites and I would not spend $120 retail on this.  3 - 3.5 / 5
If this don't pass as 5 stars, then I'm not sure what does. It's perfect in every aspect.

Found this at a local watering hole (Overtime in Lombard, IL.) that has a fantastic bourbon selection.  Nose has a medicinal value due to the intense rye, grains, cheerios, floral, slight sweet.  Palate of nutmeg and other cooking spices, cherry cough drops, rye dough, young un-ripened berries.  Mouth feel coats the entire mouth with a slight oil and a lovely oil numbing.  If you're a rye lover do not pass this up.  Keep drinking my friends... Skol

This is impeccable. This rye doesn't kick too much or weigh you down. It seemed pretty clean and balanced. It seemed dryer or maybe slightly smoky? It was such a different taste then I normally expect from a rye I has trouble making out some of the complexities! Bravo, Lock, Stock, and Barrel-- you are a lovely rye.

Pogo in Dallas for Ricky 2014 Xmas. 
$ 120 ?  Really like this one, great rye flavor

The palette is warm and tasty without being overwhelming. The spice kicks in on the finish nice finish and leads to a feeling of warmth as it travels down the throat. Hearty, not sweet or floral.  Oily in the mouth feel.
This tastes a lot like Whistle Pig but has the strong rye finish the standard WP lacks. A lot of people really don't like this though. I would strongly recommend trying at a bar before you buy.
This is phenomenal! Herbaceous, spicy, extremely complex. This is a great rye. Highly recommended if you love rye.
initially a little sweetness. nice warming throughout.
Pretty great rye. Loved having this on the Chill Filtered Podcast.
Super smooth, possibly the smoothest rye i have ever drank to date. Lots of flavor, i struggle to give it 5 stars based on taste at the $110 price tag. If it was cheaper it would get 5 stars.

Puts other rye whiskeys to shame! Sweet and spicy flavors to rave about; black licorice jelly beans, carnival cotton candy, Brazilian pink peppercorns, smoldering bonfire the next morning. Plus a great tingle to remember it by.

Arguably one of, if not the, best rye I’ve had to date. 

Mellow heat throughout but tons of flavor with a finish that just keeps on giving. 

The price is the only set back like others stated. If you can try it do yourself a favor and go for it

Neat. Unique flavor. Different than anticipated ... in a good way

"0-1: Beyond bad. Complete waste of money according to my tastebuds. 
2: Bad. Simply not my taste
2.5: Sub-par. Ill drink it... but only because its whiskey.
3: Good. Decent stuff, but not a rebuy
3.5: Very good. I might buy again
4: Excellent: Will be purchasing a bottle asap
4.5: Incredible: top of the purchase list
5:Amazing: cost and taste are worth every cent""
evergreen. sugar and baking spice. rye musty-ness. pleasent mint.
Significantly better than I remember. This bottle has been open for awhile so not sure if it is the hooch or if it is me. Not spicy but definitely bold flavor. Very enjoyable.
Very good rye with some classic rye spice, pepper, anise. A little less smooth than I would expect for a 13 year. Tasty but not worth the price point.
Vanilla, maple syrup and brown sugar nose, grassy, very smooth all the way
So smooth and creamy nutty, citrus creamsicle as well
Good nose, if muted. This tastes like gin infused tea. Slight cacao nib bitterness. 12/6/19
Spicy, and there was a lot going on, but with all that still very good. The bottle stands out in a crowd and begs to be drank.
